column1: length ball around off and middle, dabbed towards square leg to get off the mark
back of length around off, Guptill stays in the crease and defends it towards cover-point
length around off once again, Guptill drops it towards cover-point once again and looks to sneak in a single but Hetmyer is quick to the ball
length ball on the pads, Gutpill was in two minds, whether to go over mid-on or over midwicket, ends up playing all around it and gets rapped in the thigh
fuller around off, comes forward and pushes it towards mid-on, another dot
short of length outside off, some extra bounce for Umesh but not trouble for Guptill there as he dabs it past the diving Kohli at first slip for a single
a touch full around off and angling, Guptill looks to drive on the up, gets an inside edge on to the pads
length ball on the pads this time, Gutpill accepts it gleefully and glances it fine, the ball races away towards the fine leg boundary
use of feet this time and launches it over the bowler's head, all the way for a six. Wasn't a bad delivery, a length ball around off but Guptill showing his class here
short of length around off, dabbed towards the right of Kohli at first slip, Kohli has a shy at the bowler's end. No one is back there and moreover, there was never a chance, four overthrows
fuller around off, once again coming back in to the batsman, Saha was looking to play on the leg side, an inside edge on to the pads
150.9kph but Saha has absolutely smashed it, length around off, Saha comes forward and plays it on the up, finds the gap at cover
length ball around off, Guptill gives himself some room and hits it over extra cover this time, second six for him
bouncer from Umesh, around middle and leg, spongy bounce and Guptill just sways away and lets it go
a slower one from Umesh this time, short of length around off, Guptill plays it with soft hands and steals a single to the right of Parthiv
dropped by Chahal! Short of length around off and middle and Saha brings out the pull, Chahal is stationed at deep square leg for this shot, in and out of his hands
short one from Umesh, around middle and leg, Guptill looks to hook it fine but misses. An appeal from Parthiv but no contact there with the bat or anything else
fuller around off, looks to smash it down the ground but mistimes it towards mid-on
length ball around off, Saha goes for the sweep, gets a top edge but it sails over short fine leg and trickles over the rope
short of length around middle, goes back and pulls it in front of square, to the right of the midwicket fielder
tossed up on middle and leg this time, and Saha backs away a bit and chips it over mid-off, just over the fielder and that's the third successive four
once again slower in the air, length ball on middle and leg, Saha goes back and works it towards square leg
flatter this time, on middle and leg, Guptill comes forward and pushes at it, gets an inside edge on to the front pad, a single as the ball rolls towards square leg
slower in the air, Saha backs away and adjusts to dab it towards short third man in the end
length ball on the pads, Saha goes for the flick but mistimes, collects a single to short fine leg
length ball around off, Guptill waits for it and plays it gently towards covers
slower length ball around off and middle, bowled at 123kph. Saha was looking to go over mid-on but doesn't get the timing right and Umesh makes no mistake at mid-on
fuller on the stumps, drives it towards mid-off and sets off, a makes it safely in the end despite a direct hit
length ball around off, comes forward and punches it towards point, a fumble by Hetmyer but he recovers quickly. This was bowled at 152.4 kph
another slower one but this one is short of length outside off, Guptill backs away and smashes it over extra cover for four
length ball on the stumps, Pandey backs away and punches it towards extra cover
almost rolls down on to the stumps, fuller outside leg, Pandey was looking to flick it towards midwicket, an inside edge on to the pads and almost shaves off the off stump on its way
flatter on the stumps, goes back and looks to flick it away, an inside edge on the back leg
and it almost goes past where Kohli was standing. Tossed up in the air, Pandey looks to launch it over deep midwicket, the ball takes an outside edge and goes towards short third man
flighted on the leg stump, Guptill goes for the flick, ends up playing it too fine, towards short fine leg
flatter on middle and leg, looks to work on the leg side, gets an outside edge towards short third man
length ball around off, Pandey plants his front foot and drives it on the up between extra cover and mid-off
length ball around off, Pandey looks to dab it down but ends up playing too fine, a couple of bounce to Parthiv
short of length around middle, Pandey plays a short arm pull with the left leg in the air, the nataraja shot as they say
length ball around middle and leg, comes forward and pushes it back towards the bowler
short of length near the rib cage, Guptill pulls it firmly but there is protection at deep square leg
short of length outside off, Pandey opens the face of the bat to run it towards third man
flatter around off, Pandey goes back and tucks it towards backward square leg
and he strikes with his second ball, flatter around off, Guptill stays back and chips it towards short midwicket to Kohli, soft dismissal and Guptill is not happy with himself
length ball around off, goes back and punches it towards long-on with a straight bat
length ball around off, goes back and turns it away towards square leg

length ball, not that short but Pandey goes back and goes for the pull, doesn't get the power behind hit and Hetmyer dives forward at midwicket to take it inches off the ground. The umpires are checking upstairs but Hetmyer took it well above the ground, near the ankle height but did the ball touch the ground as he rolled over? That's the question. Was the catch complete by then? He looks in control of the ball and his own movement as well. Also, it's not clear if the ball even touched the ground and that is out
length ball around off, comes forward and defends
length ball around off, stays back and punches it towards covers, de Villiers makes a stop
length again and another punch, this time straight towards de Villiers at extra cover
length ball around off, punched towards backward point and looks to sneak in a quick single, Kohli is quick to the ball
a sharp bouncer angling across the batsman, Vijay was looking to shape up for a pull, bails out in the end
fuller around off, comes forward and drives it towards long-off
short of length outside off, stays back and punches it towards sweeper cover
short of length around off, goes back and punches it towards extra cover
fuller around off, comes forward and flicks it towards short midwicket
length ball around off and middle, flicked away towards midwicket for one
length ball around off, punched towards long-on for one more
length ball on the stumps, goes deep in his crease and flicks it towards midwicket, sprints back for the second
short of length outside off, goes back and cuts it past short fine leg for four
in the air but safely through cover. Is there a slow patch somewhere on this pitch? Guptill's wicket was another clue. Length and just outside off, pokes at it and is through the shot too early
length at middle stump, punched to long-on, on the up
short of a length and in at middle stump. Jammed into the leg side off the back foot
so pretty. Short of a length outisde off. Gets his weight into his toes and holds his balance as he punches this past midwicket. High elbow and all
short of a length in the corridor, opens the face and runs it down to third man
short and climbing in the corridor, looks to pull but that rises past the blade
lovely dip to beat the outside edge. Draws Williamson in for the forward block and rips it past the bat outside off
length on leg stump, flicked to deep square
length on leg stump, flicked to deep backward square
tossed up at off stump, gets forward and looks to drop this into the off side for a single. But Gurkeerat is in close and swoops down at it quickly from point
length on middle stump, defended into the leg side
full on off stump, driven straight to extra cover
and then Shankar. That doesn't look faster than 115kph. So it being short is a gift for Shankar. Allows it to climb outside off and pumps it over the midwicket boundary
leading edge clears point. Short of a length at middle stump. Looks to slog over midwicket again but loses his shape
length on leg stump, flicked to deep square
short and wide outside off, cut straight to point
full and shaping away wide outside off. Jammed to extra cover's left
length and in at middle stump. Pushed to point with soft hands
short and just outside off, cut to sweeper cover
length at middle and leg. Shuffles across for the sweep and misses as it spins down leg. Not called wide, probably the right decision. Shankar moved across a long way
short and flat outside off. Stays still this time, allows it to rise off the surface and slaps it over the wide long-on region
shot! Not to the itch of this and it is climbing up on him outside off, but he still gets the slog sweep over deep square. Big reach, familiar bowler

and he gets him! Length ball outside off, grips and cllimbs as he gets down for yet another slog sweep. He's too slow going down though and ends up slicing it straight up for short fine to run into and hold on. Good trajectory from the bowler, invited him to hit again after changing the angle
short of a length just outside off, cut to sweeper cover
past off stump. Slams this in, back of a length, but it skids low as Williamson gets behind the line to try and pull
dropped! Khejroliya off balance in his follow through and can't get his hands around this. Length at leg stump, backs away and punches it straight back to the bowler
whips it over deep square. Smooth movements from KW. This is full on middle and off. He steps into the off stump to get behind the line and just uses the pace to flick him square
short at leg stump, backs into the leg side and mistimes a pull to deep square's right
bouncer dug in too short. Doesn't even need to duck to let that go
short of a length on middle stump, dropped into the off side with soft hands

over midwicket this time. Smart batting. Khejroliya is looking to take it across off stump every ball. Williamson knows this, because there's no one back at midwicket. Shuffles again, gets the weight into his back foot and slaps it in front of square
length on leg stump, pushed into the leg side with soft hands
quicker one, down leg. Can't connect on the flick
short of a length and turning away outside off. Poked to deep extra cover off the back foot
length at middle, nudged into the leg side
length ball, slow and wide outside off. Nothing on that to help manufacture an aggressive shot. He taps it on the head to deep extra

gets him! Once again, giving the batsmen nothing to manufacture a big hit! Dipping at a length, so slow, and wide outside off. He wants to slap that over wide long-off, but because of the pace, the ball is bound to get big on him. Slices it for deep extra
length on leg stump, flicked to deep square
lapped past short fine. Picks the offcutter and gets low outside off. Quick hands and the ball rises off the face to go fine of the fielder
short of a length outside off, looks to pull and gets an inside edge onto front pad
short and just outside off, cut to sweeper cover
oh, hello. Walks deep into the crease, keeps the front leg out of the way and casually slots this full ball wide of mid-off, first ball
short and wide outside off. Misses on the cut
not connected well. Not gone far. Length ball climbing as he looks to slog. Gets too far under it and ends up lifting it off the high part to Gurkeerat's right at long-on. He runs in and holds on
short and slanted across off stump. Chopped to third man
looks for the ramp but can't get bat on it. Full outside off, gets the front leg out but cops it on the back pad
taken at deep midwicket. Sunrisers tumbling fast. Short ball at off stump. Cramps him at the body as he looks to pull. Can't get it off the middle and Hetmyer is there to take this
legcutter, back of a length outside off. Cut to deep backward point
short at off stump, gets up and drops it into the covers with soft hands
legcutter at a length on leg stump. Gets low and slugs this off the inside half to deep square's left
short and wide outside off, cut to deep point
length just outside off, gets forward and pokes into the covers
short of a length just outside off, nice looking back foot punch but it is straight to sweeper cover
short and very wide outside off. Looks for the upper cut but that is too quick for him
length outside off, backs away and chucks his hands at it. Thick outside edge to third man's left
slower yorker wide outside off. He shuffles but can only jam this down to deep point
lofts it over mid-off and brings up his fifty. Full and wide outside off. Shuffles and has to adjust. Decides to offer the full face and nails the connection
lifted over mid-off again. Oh boy. Low full toss outside off. Two times he's bowled the exact ball you don't bowl with mid-off in. Both times Williamson helps himself

and now over the square leg boundary! Lovely batting. Shuffles to get into line again. Umesh bowls length. An offcutter. He picks it and swings. Just gets it over the boundary, but it has safely bisected deep square and deep midwicket

extra cover boundary! Another full toss outside off. He's feeding Williamson for the exact shots that he uses in the slog overs - and mind you, he doesn't have as much power and range as some other batsmen. The cover drive though, he will put you away every time. Latches onto it and lifts it on the bounce over the boundary
full outisde off and he can only jam it to deep midwicket's left. It's a no-ball...and it's a wrong call. His heel was marginally behind. Nigel Llong the umpire
swept to deep square's right. Full toss on off stump, gets low and mistimes the shot
gets it to fine leg. He didn't have a clue how, but it's got there. Bouncer at middle stump, backs away, swings from underneath and gets a top edge over short fine
length ball but down the leg side, and RCB are off the mark
length ball around off, punched off the back foot but straight towards cover
length and angling across the Parthiv, who walks towards the ball and looks to loft it on the leg side, misses
length ball once again, on the leg stump this time, Parthiv looks to pull it over square leg but ends up top-edging it towards backward point, Pandey backpedals and takes it comfortably
length around off, comes forward and pushes it towards covers
a touch fuller outside off, Kohli comes forward and looks to go over extra cover, the bottom hand comes off the bat as the ball travels over backward point and dribbles towards the boundary
length around off, dabbed towards third man for one
smashed past mid-off. Fuller around off, Kohli comes forward and drills it down the ground
this is stick cricket, Brian Lara 1998! Length ball around off and middle, Kohli comes forward and lofts it nonchalantly over wide mid-on. Cricket cannot be this simple
length ball on the pads, moves across a bit and dabs it towards square leg
length around off, de Villiers stays beside the line of the ball and steers it towards backward point

and he has nicked that one! Length ball around off and angling across, Kohli was walking into the shot and looks to drive it on the off side, gets an outside edge and Saha pouches it just below his chest, fingers pointing upwards
length ball around off, pushes at it from the front foot, a thick outside edge towards third man
length ball in the channel. Hetmyer shoulders arms
length ball around off, moves across and pushes it back towards the bowler
length around off, Hetmyer once again shuffles across and tucks it towards midwicket, another dot
length ball around middle and leg, flicked towards deep midwicket for one

neat catch by Guptill at first slip! Length ball in the channel, around fifth stump, de Villiers pushes at it but extra bounce means he gets a healthy outside edge, Guptill latches on to the ball with both hands as it was flying to his right
length ball around off, stays behind the line of this and defends it towards the bowler
length around off, Hetmyer comes forward and taps it towards backward point, a diving stop to his right by Pandey there
short of length around off and that has been smashed through midwicket, pulled away with disdain
length outside off, backs away and cuts it through covers this time, consecutive fours
short and wide this time, Hetmyer was moving towards the leg side and cannot reach to the ball in the end, called a wide
short of length following the batsman this time, Hetmyer backs away and forehands it towards mid-on, doesn't get the timing right
a short one over the batsman's shoulder, Gurkeerat goes for the hook but fails to connect. It seemed there was some sort of sound as the ball went past the batsman but nothing on the UltraEdge
short of length outside off, some room there as well, Gurkeerat has punched it past point for a boundary
length ball angling across, Gurkeerat looks to steer this one past point as well but it's a touch too close to him, gets beaten
length ball down the leg side, Hetmyer misses the flick but that's a wide
length around off, a googly this time, Hetmyer pushes at it and gets beaten
short of length on the stumps, goes back and drags it towards wide long-on
short of length around off, tucked away towards short midwicket off the back foot, the fielder was at the edge of the circle
fuller on the leg stump, Hetmyer clears his front leg, frees his arms and sends it over wide long-on, all the way for a six
fuller around off this time, and Hetmyer once again smashes it with all the power...only to find Gurkeerat's bat at the other end, the bat comes off his hands
length ball on the stumps, dragged away towards long-on
short of length outside off, backs away once again but cannot beat the cover fielder
a slower length ball at the batsman, Hetmyer is cramped but manages a pull towards deep midwicket
length around off, stays back and taps it towards backward point
length outside off, comes forward and pushes it towards the right of third man
short of length at the batsman once again, pulled away towards deep midwicket, a bit of fumble there by Guptill but no extra run
short of length outside off, dabs it towards third man for one
length ball outside off, cuts it towards sweeper cover
length ball on the stumps, goes back and pushes it towards the batsman
length ball on the pads, clipped away towards short fine leg
length outside off, goes back and cuts it towards backward point
length ball, angled in towards the batsman who goes back and punches it towards cover
fuller and down the leg side, swiped past short fine leg for four
length ball around off, punched towards mid-off from the crease
length ball around off once again, Gurkeerat stays back and pushes it towards long-on
length around off, throws his bat at it, only a single to deep extra cover
short of length around off, moves a bit towards the off side and pulls it aerially towards deep square leg
length ball angling in towards the batsman, Hetmyer backs away and pulls it down the ground, one bounce to Vijay Shankar
a bouncer from Thampi, moves across and pulls it towards fine leg
length around off, punched towards sweeper cover from the front foot
short of length on the stumps, rocks back and hammers it over deep midwicket, into the stands
flatter and quicker this time, angling in towards the batsman, pushed towards wide long-on
length around off, comes forward and pushes it towards deep midwicket
short around off, goes back and hits it along the ground towards long-on
fuller on the stumps, comes forward and drives it towards long-on
length ball on middle and leg, flicked away towards fine leg
short of length outside off, forehands it towards mid-off, hardly any timing on it
length ball on the pads, tucked away behind square for one
short of length around middle and leg, glanced towards fine leg
length around off and middle, backs away and pushes it towards mid-off
a touch fuller on the pads, clipped away towards deep square leg
googly, back of a length on leg stump. Flicked to short fine who parries it to deep square, unintentionally
smoked! Googly, at a length on leg stump. Gets the front leg into the leg side and slogs this over midwicket
googly, short and ripping away outside off. Out of shape, beaten on the cut

and another! Brings up his fifty with a slog sweep. Full on middle stump, gets low, and once again the front foot out of the way. Nails this. It's a pity he's not had too many games. He's going to be a big, big player over the next few years
short of a length slider outside off, pulled down to long-on
googly at a length on leg stump, looks to flick, cops it on the thigh guard
length and in at off stump. Punches it to long-on
low full toss on leg stump, clipped to deep square's right
short of extra cover. That kicks up from the surface. Length and just outside off. Opens him up as he looks to drop this into the off side
short and up at leg stump. Looks to pull and gets an under-edge into the leg side
shot! Smart batting. Anticipates the short-ish length and stays deep in the crease. Then walks inside the line of this and pulls along the floor from off stump. Into the long leg boundary
neatly drive. Length outside off and he punches to sweeper's right on the up
bouncer at a leg stump line, pulls to deep square's left

misfield and on this tiny ground, you don't recover from those! Short of a length outside off and he cuts it to point's right. He is slow getting down to it. Gets something on it, but can't stop cleanly
length on middle stump, tapped to long-on

through the hands at deep midwicket! Manish Pandey, usually plays here as a skipper. Short ball at Hetmyer who skips into the leg side and slaps this hook, flat and in front of square. Pandey takes a couple of steps to his left and is behind the line of this, but it's going too fast for his hands

dropped! Oh no oh no oh no, Yusuf. What have you done? This is what Bhuvneshwar was called back for. Slowed it down, pushed it across the batsman at a length and had him lose control, throwing his hands at it. Chipped straight to Pathan at point and he grabs at it to his left and lets it pop out

close chance at the non-striker's end. Length on middle stump, tucked to midwicket's right. Guptill is rapid to the ball as the batsmen get in a mix-up. Throws at the stumps and misses as Hetmyer leaps back in
outside edge as he looks to club this googly straight. Not close to the pitch of it. It trickles out to short third
gets it to the extra cover boundary. Googly at a length, wide outside off. Stretches his hands and drives on the up. Not fully in control, but a couple of bounces and that's four
googly at a length outside off, punched to sweeper cover
length outside off, defended off the back foot
full outside off, leans in and drives to long-off
thick edge again, but to short third man. Legbreak from wide of the crease around the wicket. Cramps him as he cuts
length in the corridor, punched on the up to mid-off
short of a length just outside off, pulled straight to midwicket
short at off stump, shuffles and pulls calmly yo the midwicket boundary
and now the other side of deep square! Slower short ball on middle stump. Easily picked and slammed to the long leg boundary

oh narrowly misses off stump. Whew, so close. That curves in late and goes past the inside edge. Or does it? Williamson has reviewed for catch behind. Not even close. He was looking to drive on the up and missed that emphatically
length on middle stump, flicked to deep square
sent to deep square first ball. Length and slanted in at middle and leg. Gets the front leg out and stylishly whips this on the up to the vacant boundary
length outside off, looks to drive. Is through it early and has to take one hand off. Uppish, but safely down to long-off
oh close call on the wide. Length ball slanted across him, left alone. It was close to the line. Shankar wasn't pleased with the call
length outside off, gets the front foot out of the way and slaps at this. Off the outside half down to long-off

oh that is superbly done. Gurkeerat summons all the composure he's shown so far to get one past point to bring up his fifty. Full outside off and he opened the face and caressed it to the fielder's right

pings off deep square leg and into the boundary. Bhuvneshwar wants this ball to get higher as it dips awkwardly at him. It skids on off his calves and climbs over the rope. A pull from Gurkeerat, picked up from middle stump
misfield again. Length outside off, sliced straight to Pandey at point and he doesn't gather cleanly
short of a length on leg stump, looks to flick and cops it on the thigh
length outside off, slapped on the up to long-off
length on middle stump, punched to long-on
full outside off, looks to pump this through the off side. Gets a thick inside edge towards deep midwicket
nicely directed bouncer. Up at the left shoulder. Looks to hook and is beaten
yorker at off stump, jammed towards mid-off to steal the single
slapped over deep square! They just haven't let Rashid settle down. Googly, short at leg stump. Gets back in the crease and gets it flat to the fielder's left
short of a length on middle stump, nudged to long-on off the back foot
pulled over long-on! Short ball in at middle stump from around the wicket. Uses the angle, uses the depth in the crease and, most importantly, the poor length. Drills it

taken at long-off. Shankar stretches up and holds on to it in front of the SRH dugout. Hetmyer is livid with himself. He lost control of that shot. Short ball, googly, spinning away outside off. He wanted to cut firmly but that got big on him and he had to check his shot. It's commentary on the size of this ground that this shot was taken narrowly inside play because he didn't time that too well. But what a fantastic innings. Stunning, as he always is when he spends any amount of decent time in the middle
past the outside edge. Length outside off, pokes at it and isn't close to connecting
length at middle stump, flicked to deep midwicket
full and just outside off, driven off the toe-end to long-off
length ball down leg side, looks to flick, won't connect

straight to point! Slower short ball outside off from around the wicket. He looks to chop this over point but he finds Yusuf Pathan who - finally - finds the ball. Gurkeerat and Hetmyer have both departed after bringing it till here. Is there something in this still for SRH? We'll see. But for now - what a super knock. And all things considered, a statement, from Gurkeerat. He's an experienced domestic player. Even played for India once, remember. He's played a lovely, calm knock today
yorker, wide outside off. Looks to chop, beaten

taken at mid-off! Oh you're kidding me! The Chinnaswamy crowd must have seen more twists in this stage of a game than anyone else. Sundar with...to be honest, an utterly pathetic shot. Slower short of a length ball outside off. He shuffles, presumably to pull. But ends up jabbing at it, well in front of his body. Chipped straight over the bowler and Pandey hangs on
slower short ball wide outside off, late cut is going going going...until Bhvuneshwar chucks his body at it and stops to his right
slower ball at a length on middle stump, flicked into the leg side
full on middle stump, drilled down to long-on

slaps it to the point boundary! For all the silence he evoked with that 28-run over, Umesh has the crowd delirious right now. What a shot. Full and flat and wide from Nabi and he times this perfectly to get it past point
and Umesh with the winning runs! He had it planned all along! Overpitched outside off again, flat again. Lots of pace again. And lots of gusto as Umesh swings for it to get it past cover
